oai_dc:dc.dc:title: EXTREMAL STATISTICS OF STORM SURGES BY TYPHOON
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tsuchiya, Yoshito
Kawata, Yoshiaki
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: storm surge
typhoon
statistics
extreme statistics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The objective of this paper is to propose a new approach based on the direction of the typhoon track for determining the probability of occurrence of extremal tides due to storm surges, as well as their return period. The study includes the effects of periods in tidal data and of tidal variation stemming from extensive reclamation along coasts on the fitness of the extremal data to probability density functions. The method is justified by application to an analysis of the probability of occurrence of storm surges in Osaka bay.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 19 (1984): Proceedings of 19th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Houston, Texas, 1984.; 8
